name: ChocolateyCommand
description: Run various Chocolatey commands, including pack, push, install, upgrade, etc.
author: gep13

inputs.name: command
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Chocolatey command to run. Select 'custom' to use other commands that are available [here](https://chocolatey.org/docs/commands-reference).

inputs.name: extraArguments
inputs.label: Extra Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional Chocolatey Arguments that are not catered for above.

inputs.name: verbose
inputs.label: Show verbose messaging.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Very verbose messaging, avoid using under normal circumstances.

inputs.name: trace
inputs.label: Show trace messaging.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Very, very verbose trace messaging. Avoid except when needing super low-level .NET Framework debugging.

inputs.name: apikeySource
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source that is associated with the ApiKey.

inputs.name: apikeyApikey
inputs.label: ApiKey
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ApiKey that should be used when pushing to the source.

inputs.name: configOperation
inputs.label: Config Operation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to set or unset a config value.

inputs.name: configName
inputs.label: Config Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The config name which is going to set or unset.

inputs.name: configValue
inputs.label: Config Value
inputs.helpMarkDown: Parameters to pass to the package.

inputs.name: customCommand
inputs.label: Command
inputs.helpMarkDown: The Chocolatey Command that you would like to execute.

inputs.name: customArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Chocolatey Arguments that should be passed to the command.

inputs.name: featureOperation
inputs.label: Feature Operation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to enable or disable a feature.

inputs.name: featureName
inputs.label: Feature Name

options.failOnInvalidOrMissingLicense: Fail On Invalid or Missing License

inputs.helpMarkDown: The feature name which is going to be enabled or disabled.

inputs.name: installPackageId
inputs.label: The id of the package(s) that are to be installed.
inputs.helpMarkDown: For example, windirstat.

inputs.name: installPackageVersion
inputs.label: The version of the package that is to be installed.
inputs.helpMarkDown: For example, 1.2.3.

inputs.name: installPre
inputs.label: Prerelease.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Include Prereleases?

inputs.name: installSource
inputs.label: The source to find the package(s) to install.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Special sources include: ruby, webpi, cygwin, windowsfeatures, and python. To specify more than one source, pass it with a semi-colon separating the values (e.g. "'source1;source2'"). Defaults to default feeds.

inputs.name: installInstallArgs
inputs.label: Install Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Install Arguments to pass to the native installer in the package.

inputs.name: installParams
inputs.label: Package Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Parameters to pass to the package.

inputs.name: installForce
inputs.label: Force the behavior.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Do not use force during normal operation - it subverts some of the smart behavior for commands.

inputs.name: installX86
inputs.label: Force X86.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Force x86 (32bit) installation on 64 bit systems.

inputs.name: installOverride
inputs.label: Override Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should install arguments be used exclusively without appending to current package passed arguments?

inputs.name: packOperation
inputs.label: How many nuspec files?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to pack a single nuspec file, or multiple.

inputs.name: packWorkingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location of the nuspec file(s).

inputs.name: packNuspecFileName
inputs.label: NuSpec File Name.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file name of the NuSpec File that should be packed.

inputs.name: packVersion
inputs.label: Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The version you would like to insert into the package.

inputs.name: packOutputDirectory
inputs.label: Output Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location where the generated nupkg(s) should be placed.

inputs.name: pushOperation
inputs.label: How many nupkg files?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to pus a single nupkg file, or multiple.

inputs.name: pushWorkingDirectory
inputs.label: Working Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location of the nupkg file(s).

inputs.name: pushNupkgFileName
inputs.label: Nupkg File Name.
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file name of the Nupkg File that should be pushed.

inputs.name: chocolateySourceType
inputs.label: Source to push Chocolatey Packages to
inputs.helpMarkDown: This can either be set directly in the Task definition, by setting the source and API Key, but by selecting pre-defined Chocolatey source from your Organisation settings.

inputs.name: pushSource
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The source to push the nupkg(s) to.

inputs.name: pushApikey
inputs.label: API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: The API Key that should be used to push the nupkg(s) to specified source.

inputs.name: externalEndpoint
inputs.label: Chocolatey server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The NuGet service connection that contains the external Chocolatey serverâ€™s credentials.

inputs.name: pushForce
inputs.label: Force.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Force the operation to continue.

inputs.name: pushTimeout
inputs.label: Timeout
inputs.helpMarkDown: The time, in seconds, to allow a package push to occur before timing out.

inputs.name: sourceOperation
inputs.label: Source Operation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to add, remove, enable or disable a source.

inputs.name: sourceSourceName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name to give the Source.

inputs.name: sourceSource
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name to give the Source.

inputs.name: sourcePriority
inputs.label: Priority
inputs.helpMarkDown: The priority order of this source as compared to other sources, lower is better. Defaults to 0 (no priority). All priorities above 0 will be evaluated first, then zero-based values will be evaluated in config file order.

inputs.name: user
inputs.label: User
inputs.helpMarkDown: Used with authenticated feeds.

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The user's password to the source. Encrypted in chocolatey.config file.

inputs.name: cert
inputs.label: Client Certificate
inputs.helpMarkDown: PFX pathname for an x509 authenticated feeds.

inputs.name: certPassword
inputs.label: Certificate Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: the client certificate's password to the source.

inputs.name: byPassProxy
inputs.label: Bypass Proxy.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Should this source explicitly bypass any explicitly or system configured proxies?
